page.title: 05Education-Cause for Concern
page.content: Residents of the northern sector of our 'D' Block expressed concern about the present position of education. Their greatest worry was that the reduction in the numbers of children attending the schools had resulted in a reduction in the numbers of teachers and an increase in class size.We carried out a detailed survey of one school and found that in 1980 there were 348 children and 14 teachers, ratio 24.8 to 1. At present there are 255 children and 10 teachers , a ratio of 25.5 to 1.Whereas in 1980 the largest class had only 30 children, because of the differences in numbers in each year group there are now 35 children in the largest class and 27 children in the smallest. The staff, parents and children all believe that when children are in too large classes learning is impeded.
